entry.title: [iOS] Reload tab grid for supervised user
entry.content:
Currently, the tab grid view is initialized at start up and does not

refresh to reflect changes, such as supervised users signing in and

disable incognito mode.



This change adds listening to the supervised user status and replacing

the previous incognito view controller with the appropriate one.

entry.title: [fyfre] Check if browser is already default before showing prompt in FRE
entry.content:
This CL adds a check in HandleIdentityStepsCompleted() to verify if the

browser is already set as default before showing the default browser

prompt step in the FRE.



A timeout closure is also added, since this is done asynchronously via

DefaultWebClientWorker::StartSetAsDefault().



A OnceCallback is added to FirstRunFlowControllerDice to show the

default browser step of skip it, which will be called by the

StartSetAsDefault() or the timeout closure callback, or if the step has

already been skipped beforehand.



Bug: 1465822

Change-Id: I97d8004a4dd0b4b6cd0695457d0a8507e970e826

entry.title: cellular: Extract name from policy instead of service
entry.content:
The name property of a service does not match the name of the

corresponding network that was configured via policy. This change

updates the policy application logic to extract the name from the policy

instead of the translated service properties.



Bug: b/278135433

Test: Manually verified on device.

entry.title: Only call AutofillPopupDelegate::OnPopupShown if popup was shown.
entry.content:
Prior to this change, AutofillPopupControllerImpl::Show does not return

early if AutofillPopupView::Show does not result in actually showing

the popup.



This means that AutofillPopupControllerImpl::Show will call

AutofillPopupDelegate::OnPopupShown even though

- The popup was never shown.

- AutofillPopupDelegate::OnPopupHidden was called just before it,

since failure to show the popup results in PopupViewViews

calling Hide() on the controller and the controller calls

OnPopupHidden.



Bug: 1469871

Change-Id: I5b9be19c9659f34cc8ffe55d6a6c7690f8eb682e

entry.title: [minizip] Check for overly long filename/comment when creating member
entry.content:
The zip file format uses 16-bit numbers to represent the length of

filenames and comments. Passing a longer filename or comment would

generate an invalid file or could lead to heap overflow.

entry.title: Reland "Reland "[Files app] Set Files app minimum size to 596x240""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 63c0e70088093e5a3e0875dcfb51c93b147a68ce.



Reason for revert: This should work for 596 width.



Min width = (1200 / 2) - (8 / 2) = 596.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:ash/wm/splitview/split_view_controller.cc;l=848-851;drc=b86abfa407f3f35d3e5904e76b9a8d3a741bdc8b



Original change's description:

> Revert "Reland "[Files app] Set Files app minimum size to 600x240""

>

> This reverts commit 4808cea941c28e4578e128ebf25d13d3fa4bb27f.

>

> Reason for revert: Eve builders failing with failed to split screen files window.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reland "[Files app] Set Files app minimum size to 600x240"

> >

> > This reverts commit 8979bb0d2223b1038bda537ccc1037ef04bc0114.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Test devices (eve) have 1200px width and snapping

> > will only work for windows up to 600px in tablet mode.

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Revert "[Files app] Set Files app minimum size to 640x240"

> > >

> > > This reverts commit 73d24498569c4f74f9795195f0a15ae99d5550ad.

> > >

> > > Reason for revert: b/294872613

> > > With this minimum width, it seems that we can't have 2 FilesApp

> > > side by side on some devices and tests are failing.

> > >

> > > Original change's description:

> > > > [Files app] Set Files app minimum size to 640x240

> > > >

> > > > Complying with requirement from UX (see attached bug)

> > > > that should reduce UI issues related to viewports that

> > > > are too small.

> > > >

> > > > Those are the same minimum window dimensions currently

> > > > set for the file picker dialog (see select_file_dialog_extension.cc).

> > > >

entry.title: Add usecounters for ORB-blocks and event handlers.
entry.content:
This adds three use counters for ORB-blocked resources whose loading

triggers onload or onerror event handlers. The goal is to assess the

compatibility risk of changing ORB blocking behaviour from injecting

an empty response (ORB "v0.1" and current) to raising a network error

(ORB "v0.2" and what the standards proposal wants) for non-script-initiated fetches.



This change & the use counters are temporary and are meant to be

removed once ORB "v0.2" has launched.



Bug: 1463725

entry.title: Revert "Extract high quality images from PDF only when they are needed for OCR."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5208eafb234ba2af392851bc75e2dbac8ca288e2.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8773075837739418257



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8773075837739418257



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8773075837739418257&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4754282



Original change's description:

> Extract high quality images from PDF only when they are needed for OCR.

>

> 32-bit bitmaps with highest available quality are extracted from PDF

> files when they are loaded, so that they would be sent later to OCR

> service. To avoid the memory overhead of this process, this CL

> postpones image extraction to the time they are sent to OCR service,

> and destroys the extracted images immediately after that.

>

> AX-Relnotes: n/a

> Bug: 1471392

> Change-Id: Id337edf693d8d4a4ddd1a56d814a0d1f0e1ac5e4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4754282

> Commit-Queue: Ramin Halavati

> Commit-Queue: Lei Zhang

> Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1182463}

>

entry.title: Extract high quality images from PDF only when they are needed for OCR.
entry.content:
32-bit bitmaps with highest available quality are extracted from PDF

files when they are loaded, so that they would be sent later to OCR

service. To avoid the memory overhead of this process, this CL

postpones image extraction to the time they are sent to OCR service,

and destroys the extracted images immediately after that.



AX-Relnotes: n/a

Bug: 1471392

All dangling pointers were caused by artificial test-setups in which

the autofill driver is deleted before the authenticator. In practice,

this cannot happen because the authenticator is owned by the

CreditCardAccessManager, which is owned by the BrowserAutofillManager,

which, in turn, is owned by the driver.

entry.title: arc: Files app: Add nullptr check for ArcFileSystemOperationRunner
entry.content:
Currently, GetArcDocumentsProviderThumbnailFunction::GotContentUrls()

performs no nullptr check against the return value of

ArcFileSystemOperationRunner::GetForBrowserContext().

In order to prevent crashes on unexpected race conditions (e.g. cases

where browser_context() is updated during async tasks), add a nullptr

check, and return early with an error message if the value is nullptr.

Note that this is the only place where the function's return value is

not checked.



Bug: b:293647109

Test: Manually confirm that GetArcDocumentsProviderThumbnailFunction

Test: gracefully handles cases where ArcFileSystemOperationRunner is

Test: nullptr; an error message is emitted to the log, but Files app

Test: keeps functioning.

entry.title: Do not decode high bit depth (HBD) images as 8-bit.
entry.content:
In GpuImageDecodeCache::CreateImageInfoForDrawImage, always decode

HBD images as HBD. Historically we only decoded HDR high bit depth

images as HBD if the target display was HDR. Change this to be

the case for all WCG and HDR content(because the results are not good

when decoding HDR images and then tonemapping them to SDR, and also

when decoding BT2020 gamut images to 8-bit).



In the WebGLImageConversion::ImageExtractor constructor, decode

HBD images to HBD. Rework the function to be very explicit about

when and why we are re-decoding an image.



WebGL conformance tests should be added for this functionality.



Bug: 1363056

entry.title: Migrate ImageLoader from fileManagerPrivate to imageLoaderPivate API
entry.content:
Create new imageLoaderPrivate permission to be used by ImageLoader

instead of fileManagerPrivate. Besides chrome://file-manager, only

ImageLoader is using this permission, so it could be deleted except

that it is also required for tests. Updated allowlist so that

empty means that no extensions are allowed.



Move the 3 thumbnail APIs from fileManagerPrivate to new

imageLoaderPrivate.



Change how ImageLoader accesses the file system. Previously ImageLoader

had the fileSystem.requestFileSystem permission and would call

fileMangerPrivate.getVolumeMetadataList() and listen to

fileManagerPrivate.onMountCompleted events to track all mounts and then

call fileSystem.requestFileSystem() for each volume in order to be

granted permissions so that it could fetch filesystem: URLs to

produce thumbnails. In addition to having permission to read the

filesystem: URLs, ImageLoader was also calling

webkitResolveLocalFileSystemURL() to get the Entry objects which are

passed into functions such as fileManagerPrivate.getPdfThumbnail().



ImageLoader is now changed so that it is never granted

requestFileSystem() and cannot get the Entry objects (which allow

modification of files), but instead we directly grant access in

FileSystemBackend.IsAccessAllowed() in the same way that we do

for chrome://file-manager, and the APIs take a DOMString url rather than

Entry (but this turns out to be a no-op since we were always

converting these under the covers).



This change for ImageLoader should mean that it now has read-only

access to all files, rather than read-write, and it is restricted to

only 3 thumbnail APIs rather than the full set of fileManagerPrivate.



Bug: b/293534917

Change-Id: I6696672d27969f69005fdd11646f7d9276d41fe4

entry.title: jellyroll shadow [part 4]: window shadow
entry.content:
This cl follows crrev.com/c/4676143



Design doc: go/jellyroll-shadow



To apply dynamic shadow colors to shadows created by

ShadowController, we add a new method to ShadowControllerDelegate

called ApplyColorThemeToWindowShadow. Then, make

ash::WmShadowControllerDelegate implement this function to apply

dynamic colors.



To apply dynamic colors, we add a helper class called

ShadowColorizer which observes the color provider sources (Widget)

of the window and updates the shadow colors map on color provider

change.



Unit tests will be added in the following cl.

entry.title: AbortSignal: Don't use ActiveScriptWrappable
entry.content:
HasPendingActivity() returning false depends on empty abort (or

prioritychange) algorithms, which in turn depends on AlgorithmHandles

being GCed. Because of this, it can take 2 GC cycles to clean up state,

which in extreme cases can result in OOM (see crbug.com/1469367).



This CL fixes this by making AbortSignal not an ActiveScriptWrappable.

The HasPendingActivity() condition is replaced with:



1. Maintain strong refs to composite abort signals with observers:

A. AbortSignalRegistry is expanded to track composite signals with

event listeners for the corresponding composition type.

B. AlgorithmHandle stores the signal, which keeps the signal alive

as long as its algorithms set is non-empty.



2. Remove the refs from (1) when a signal is aborted or its source

signals set becomes empty.



NOTE: (2) relies on detecting when the (weak) source signal set becomes

empty, which relies on the AbortController prefinalizer. As a follow-up,

we should consider removing the finalizer and using custom weakness to

detect the empty set, which would simplify the settling logic.



Another approach that has the same effect is to not rely on GC for

removing the abort algorithms, but this can't be guaranteed without

un-oilpanning the handle, which gets messy (e.g. being destroyed during

GC). ActiveScriptWrappable is advised against anyways, so replacing it

is a better option.



Bug: 1471514

Change-Id: I494abc828d015d6917485c8a1c5b413988052929

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4748873

entry.title: WebNN: Post GraphBuilder::Compile method into thread pool
entry.content:
This CL is to post the GraphBuilder::Compile method into thread pool

to avoid blocking the GPU main thread. This method compiles all DML

operators into an IDMLCompiledOperator which can be dispatched to GPU.

IDMLDevice1::CompileGraph called in this method needs long time to

compile shaders (if not cached before), so this method may block the

GPU main thread.



The GraphImpl::CompileOnBackgroundThread and

GraphImpl::OnCompilationComplete methods are defined and run with

base::ThreadPool::PostTaskAndReplyWithResult. The former will run in

thread pool and the latter will run back on GPU main thread.



Bug: 1273291

entry.title: Fix slowness of source indexing and other problems
entry.content:
In late June the source indexing step on Windows builds went from taking

about 15 minutes to taking several hours. This is because a rust

toolchain directory was added and its files are not mapped in as a git

repo. Therefore every one of these files that was referenced in the

source information had "git log" run on it, and this command is slow,

especially on non-existent files. Source indexing of chrome.dll went

from 45 seconds to 4,500 s - 100x slower. Source indexing of

gaia1_0.dll was similarly slowed. Nothing else seemed to be affected.



The output and C++ toolchain directories are already excluded from

source indexing because of this issue, so all we need to do is add

another excluded directory. This time I'm adding a --excluded-dirs

switch to make it generic and more obvious. I'm also making other

changes:

1) The toolchain and output directories used to have to be specified as

absolute paths. Passing a relative path would make the script take hours

longer. The script should make them absolute, and should fail if the

specified directory does not exist.

2) The lack of an encoding passed to subprocess was causing various

decode exceptions that presumably caused information to be lost, and

also cluttered the output.

3) Some Python 2/3 compatibility hacks can now be removed.

4) Since calling git log when a file doesn't exist is expensive this

change adds a message whenever this happens. In my tests this message is

never hit. If it starts showing up thousands of times then the cause of

the slowdown will be obvious next time.



While this CL does make this script handle relative paths, and does fix

encoding exceptions, it does not by itself fix the performance issue.

For that a change in how this script is called will be needed, after

this CL lands.



Test commands:

#1: reproduce the problem and make sure no exclusion-dirs is

handled:

vpython3 tools/symsrc/source_index.py out\official_test\chrome.dll.pdb --build-dir=out\official_test --toolchain-dir=third_party\depot_tools\win_toolchain\vs_files\27370823e7



#2: use exclusion-dirs to get a 100x speedup:

vpython3 tools/symsrc/source_index.py out\official_test\chrome.dll.pdb --build-dir=out\official_test --toolchain-dir=third_party\depot_tools\win_toolchain\vs_files\27370823e7 --exclusion-dirs=third_party\rust-toolchain



#3: use exclusion-dirs with semi-colon separation to replace using

--build-dir (still fast):

vpython3 tools/symsrc/source_index.py out\official_test\chrome.dll.pdb --toolchain-dir=third_party\depot_tools\win_toolchain\vs_files\27370823e7 --exclusion-dirs=third_party\rust-toolchain;out\official_test



A clean copy of chrome.dll.pdb is needed for each test. The freshly

built DLL was copied elsewhere and then copied back before each test.



See README.chromium for more testing ideas.



Bug: 1471723

Change-Id: I9d28a44ba2bed9d52258c42961e14ddf432ac4bd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4771880

Reviewed-by: Sébastien Marchand

entry.title: [Element Level Capture #⁠2] Add new ObjectPaintProperties node
entry.content:
This Patch:

This patch is the first step in getting elements painted and composited separately for element level capture, by adding a new ElementCaptureEffect node to the object paint properties.



The Project:

Element level capture is a new mode of tab capture being implemented that allows developers to capture subsections of the DOM, meaning that occluding content is never captured (unless the currently existing region capture mode). For more information, Googlers may visit: go/element-capture



All developers are welcome to visit the W3 spec page at:

https://screen-share.github.io/element-capture/



Coming Up Next:

1. Adding the code to mark an Element for element level capture.

2. Propagate that state through the paint system and generate a new

effect node on ObjectPaintProperties.

3. Adding a new ElementCaptureStyleTracker to generate and manage the

new effect node.

4. Working with eladlon@ to add a gated restrictTo API to enable

capture.

5. Bug fixing and stabilizations.



Bug: 1418194

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroups ] Remove tabs from storage without notifying sync
entry.content:
The sync bridge will only send the group and none of its tabs when a local deletion occurs. This will allow us to consistently update the Tab Strip when we receive a group deletion message since we no longer need to worry about the order of messages (Ex: Was this tab part of the group deletion? Or was it manually deleted).



- Reduces the discard threshold for orphaned tabs from 90 days -> 30 days

- Leaves orphaned tabs when a group deletion occurs.



Bug: 1470922

entry.title: Clear internal WebGPU canvas texture viewFormats
entry.content:
If a WebGPU canvas context is configured with a format that's not

supported by the OS natively an internal "swap texture" is also created

to copy to for compositing. This internal texture does not need any

viewFormats set and should not copy them from the user-defined texture

configuration, since they'll be incompatible.



This change forces the viewFormats to an empty list for any internal

swap textures that are created.

entry.title: Manually increase refcount in SiteInstanceGroup::RenderProcessExited
entry.content:
Increment the refcount so SiteInstanceGroup does not get deleted while

iterating over the observers. When RenderProcessExited is called,

observers are notified and can trigger the SiteInstanceGroup to be

deleted by deleting all refcounts to it. Holding a refcount to itself

ensures that it will not be deleted while still on the stack.



Since RenderProcessExited does an observer list traversal, it also

should be setting `is_notifying_observers_`.



Test: Tests fail when `is_notifying_observers_` is set to true in RenderProcessExited without refcounting

Bug: 1470323

Restricting direct access to IconView mandates proper use of MVC.

entry.title: media/gpu/test: Add timeout at the end of DecodeAndOutputAllFrames
entry.content:
resolution_change_500frames.vp9.ivf is a sequence that changes

resolution a number of times (with keyframes each time), the last

time having just 4 subsequent delta frames before EOS. The

DecodeAndOutputAllFrames test case ends as soon as V4L2VideoDecoder

has accepted the encoded chunks for decoding (i.e. the associated

DecodeCB has been signalled), so it races with the last resolution

change and the flush at the end of the stream. Something in that

race is not to the liking of Qualcomm Venus driver (sometimes

crashes in vb2_queue_cancel) and the next test finds the driver

bonkers.



This all should be studied and fixed but since we're launching the

new and improved V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder and current ToT is quite

complex, this CL proposes just circumventing the problem.



FTR the problem was repro'ed using

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests /usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/resolution_change_500frames.vp9.ivf '--vmodule=*/media/gpu/chromeos/*=2,*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=2,*/media/gpu/vaapi/*=2,*/media/gpu/*=1' --gtest_filter="*.DecodeAndOutputAllFrames:*.FlushAtEndOfStream"



Bug: 294611425

Change-Id: I7c7c93d786183b823455d05db9ed41025461628c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4771416

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

entry.title: [ ChromeRefresh2023 ] Fix caption button infinite layout loop.
entry.content:
In touch UI on Windows, the frame height depends on the caption buttons'

preferred height.



In ChromeRefresh2023, the caption buttons vertically fill the frame. This was originally done by matching the preferred height of the caption

buttons to the frame's height, causing an infinite loop in touch ui.



Now, the preferred height of the caption buttons is calculated

independently of the frame height, breaking the dependency loop.

entry.title: Save discovered app ID on window initialization
entry.content:
When windows are restored from restore data, the new restore data that

is immediately saved upon window initialization is missing fields, and

the app_id is incorrect. We default the app id to the chrome app id, and

then we find the actual app id in order to check if it is unknown. This

change solves problems associated with the missing fields by saving that

found correct app_id.

entry.title: views: triage dangling raw_ptr in WebView
entry.content:
WebView needs to hold a weak reference to one of its own child views, for

reasons explained in the first linked bug. To allow for that, this

change has WebView hold a ViewTracker for that View, rather than a

raw_ptr. This change also does some minor cleanups:



* Insertion of {} on single-line if statements

* Removal of bare `new` throughout the class and its unit tests

* Some other minor code simplifications

* Removal of a now-redundant test for the non-client-owned view case in

WebView



Bug: 1471674, 1469136

entry.title: Track hit test opaqueness of cc::Layers
entry.content:
During paint, ObjectPainter::RecordHitTestData() records hit test data

with hit test opaqueness, which is transparent with

pointer-events:none, mixed with border radius, or opaque otherwise.



The opaqueness of multiple hit test data are then merged at the

PaintChunk level, then at PendingLayer level, then is passed to

cc::Layer then cc::LayerImpl.



The new behavior is behind the blink runtime flag "HitTestOpaqueness".

The opaqueness on cc::LayerImpl will be used in the next CL to reduce

unreliable scroll begins on the compositor.



Bug: 1413877

Change-Id: I416e3cfab4157d50db3fee91aff765cb2dd4a245
